title: A petition or declaration, humbly desired to be presented to the view of His most Excellent Majestie; by all His Majesties most loyall and dutifull subjects. Shewing the great danger and inconveniences that will happen both to the King and kingdome, if either His Majestie or his people desert his grand and most faithfull councell, the high court of Parliament.
author: Parker, Henry, 1604-1652.
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "By Hen. Parker Esq"; "17 July".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
